subject name: Oral Medicine, Surgery and Special Needs
overview: This subject comprises complementary didactic and clinical components providing students with necessary skills in the disciplines of oral medicine, oral surgery and special needs. Competency in the core aspects of the Medicine and Surgery in Dentistry subject is required. Student learning will include: the part of surgery that deals with the diagnosis and surgical and adjunctive treatment of disease, injuries and defects of the human jaws and associated structures; the oral health care of patients with chronic and medically related disorders; the oral health care of people with an intellectual disability, medical, physical or psychiatric conditions.

additional pre-requisite: Successful completion of all second year DDS subjects

assessments.description: 1 x on-line MCQ test on material covered in oral surgery. 1 hours
1 x case presentation of an oral medicine case. 15 minutes
1 x case presentation on special needs. 15 minutes
1 x OSCE on oral medicine, oral surgery and special needs. 1 hours
1 x case presentation on oral surgery. 15 minutes
Reflective journal, and log of cases - to be submitted at the end of the teaching period. 1000 words. Hurdle requirement:. Pass/Fail
1 x oral group presentation on combined oral medicine, oral surgery and special needs dentistry. 1 hours
1 x  viva voce examination on material covered in oral surgery, oral medicine and special needs dentistry. 20 minutes
1 x written examination on oral surgery, oral medicine and special needs dentistry.. 2 hours
Hurdle requirement:. 75% attendance at Lectures; 100% attendance at Seminars/Tutorials, Practical Classes, Clinical Sessions, and Clinical & Case Simulations/Discussions

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
